lines.text: ...You know what I think?
What?
I think apple empanadas are delicious. I could really go for an apple empanada.
Huh? I mean- yeah, sure, but we’re workin’ here.
What if I told you I knew exactly why that wizard started the fire?
Well, that’d be-
Would you treat me to breakfast at the food trucks after we finished here? Buy me an apple empanada or two?
What, if you tell me you know why the wizard started the fire?
Exactamundo, boss!
I think if you do that... I’ll not add any more time to your parole, kid. You don’t get a prize for doin’ what you’re told.
...Empanadas do sound good, though…
...Is that a-
Sure, what the heck. We’ll get a bite after the job. Hit me.
Well...
Slick Emmup’s body, see? You notice how he’s not alive? For fire-related reasons?
Hadn’t escaped my notice, yeah. What about it?
Well… the stuff we’ve learned sorta throws his cause of death into question.
He was killed by the fire, right?
There’s no other murder weapons around, so…
Can we just assume the wizard used the fire as a murder weapon?
That’s what we already assumed, right?
Well, we know that happened, but we thought it was for a different reason.
We know the wizard couldn’t cast <c=#FF0000>Emergency Exit,</c> though, so he wouldn’t have started a fire for that.
So why start the fire at all? It’s gotta be because he intended to make sure Slick burned!
...I don’t know about that. Why use that to kill the guy?
He was trapped by <c=#0000FF>Mass Arrest Momentum,</c> right? They could’ve done it any number of ways.
They wouldn’t need an actual weapon, if they had him frozen. There’s all kinds of creative ways to kill someone who can’t fight back.
...I, uh… I guess you would know all about that, right?
I investigate a lot of homicides, kid.
...Right. So…
So he needed some reason to pick a fire to kill him. Somethin’ they needed to hide.
You’re not gettin’ any empanadas until you tell me what that is.
Aw, seriously?
Get to it, kid.
